mdRecord.dcterms:description: Naumkeag was designed as the summer estate for Joseph Hodges Choate (1832â€“1917), a prominent New York City attorney and American ambassador to the United Kingdom from 1899 to 1905, and his wife Caroline Dutcher Sterling Choate, an artist and advocate for women's education. Naumkeag was later the residence of his daughter Mabel. Mabel acquired full control of the estate after her mother's death in 1929. Mabel Choate began her long and fruitful collaboration with designer Fletcher Steele in 1926. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naumkeag [work]
